intro: Paepalanthus cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban puya, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces striking inflorescences with showy, colorful bracts that attract pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
